sentences.english: All times, how many people in order to serve the motherland has been heavy resistance difficult?
sentences.chinese: 古今中外，有多少人为了报效祖国而受到了重重阻难？

sentences.english: We are also now able to serve the motherland.
sentences.chinese: 现在的我们还无力报效祖国。

sentences.english: Study hard, grow up to serve the motherland, it is patriotism.
sentences.chinese: 认真学习，长大报效祖国，这也是爱国。

sentences.english: The 20-year stay of Qian Xuesen in America, he made profound preparations for him to serve the motherland worthily .
sentences.chinese: 钱学森在美国的20年为他报效祖国做了充分的准备。

sentences.english: My biggest ambition is to serve my country.
sentences.chinese: 我的最大志向是报效祖国。

sentences.english: For one day I can have two down sons so I can hold to country.
sentences.chinese: 为了有一天我能有两下子，可以报效祖国。

sentences.english: Mr. Salum wants to return to help his country after graduation.
sentences.chinese: 塞卢姆先生想要毕业后回国报效国家。

definition: to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
to offer one's life in sacrifice
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
to dedicate oneself to the cause of one's country (idiom)
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
